defs: = ಉನ್ಮೀಲಿಸು.
the condition, fact, quality or an instance of not being subject to restrictions, rules, taxation, etc.
facing upward; (face) turned upwards.
facing; coming toward; approaching.
disturbed by fear, impending danger, uncertainty, etc.; anxious.
ready; prepared.
= ಉನ್ಮುಖವಡೆ.
to face upward; to turn (one's face) upwards.
the act or an instance of pulling out by the roots.
(fig.) the act or an instance of destroying completely.
pulled out by the roots.
(fig.) destroyed completely.
to pull out by the roots.
(fig.) to destroy completely.
= ಉನ್ಮೂಲಿತ.
= ಉನ್ಮೂಲಿಸು.
an opening of the eyes.
the act of blowing up; expansion (of a bud into flower).
excessive joy.
a superior, excellent crown.
service; attendance; honouring; worshipping.
[a prefix somewhat equal to 'sub-' of English] lower in rank, position or importance than; subordinate to.
that forms a division into smaller or less important parts.
any of the variant forms of a morpheme as conditioned by position or adjoining sounds; allomorph.
anything produced in the course of making another thing; a secondary or incidental product or result; a by-product.
the area or portion that is close or adjacent to the neck.
proximity; vicinity; neighbourhood.
space by or near a village or its boundary.
one of the horse's paces.
a small story forming an independent part of, but to support the theme of, the main story; an episode.
an auxiliary tax levied along with or on the main one; cess.
a service or favour done to another.
an implement, instrument, apparatus, etc. used as a means to do something or bring something about.
a royal contingent; attendants of a king.
a grant of agricultural land as a mark of gratitude for the service or help received.
an article, a set of articles, used in a religious service.
to service; to render a help or service; to help; to do kindness for; to favour; to oblige.
(vīr.) a process of making ashes, that is religiously holy.
the holy ashes made in the process upakalpa.
a minor profession auxiliary to or besides one's main one; an avocation.
a help; service, kindness done for or received (another) from; the act of doing good or helping others, esp. by giving money for charitable purposes; benefaction.
he who extends help, service, kindness, etc to another (esp. in need).
= ಉಪಕಾರವರಿ.
to help; to favour; to extend kindness and service in need.
= ಉಪಕಾರಮಾಡು.
an ungrateful person; an ingrate.
to be grateful for the favour, service, help, etc. received.
tending to help others (in need); obliging.
a man who helps others (in need); a benefactor.
a woman who helps others (in need); a benefactor.
a person who helps others (in need); a benefactor.
ಉಪಕಾರಿಯಾಗು upakāriyāgu to become a benefactor; to help; to favour.
a female attendant; a woman servant.
a royal house; a palace.
a tent, temporary shed raised for a king (when on journey).
a house that has more than one floors.
the official residence of a king, emperor, etc.; a palace.
the plant Nigella sativa ( = N. indica) of Ranunculaceae family; black cumin plant.
its black seeds; black cumin.
a woman who cohabits with a man (who is married to another woman) although not legally married to him; a concubine.
(biol.) a primary division of a family of one or more genera; a sub-family.
(lingu.) a major division of a language family, above a branch.
he whose natural inclination is towards helping others; a kindly man.
(in the old system) a Brāhmaṇa who has completed his studies, and entered the householder's stage (which is second of the four stages).
an official next in rank below a chancellor, as of a university, and authorised to act as the chancellor's deputy; a vice-chancellor.
an artificial waterway for transportation or irrigation; a canal.
the plant Piper longum of Piperaceae family; long pepper plant.
its seeds; long pepper.
a disease of teeth, characterised by bleeding from the roots of teeth.
a small well; a well the water table in which is relatively nearer to the ground surface.
a long, narrow, open container of stone, metal, etc. for holding water.
helped; favoured; assisted.
= ಉಪಕೃತಿ - 1.
a charitable act or generous gift; a help; a service; a favour; an obligation.
a minor poetical work.
minor expenditure.
the point in the path of a body revolving round a centre at which it is farthest from the centre; an apocentre.
a branch of an office organisation, service centre, etc. working under another centre; a sub-centre.
the act or an instance of approaching; a going near.
a starting or commencing; a beginning.
a test of honesty; a trial of fidelity.
a plan, contrivance, means; expedient, stratagem, etc.
attendance on a patient, treatment, practice of medicine, etc.
tending to begin or start; undertaking new venture.
he who exhibits or has exhibited the tendency to start or take up a new undertaking.
the tendency to begin or to undertake new venture.
he who takes initiation; a person who begins anything; a beginner.
to begin - a) to start doing, acting, going, etc.; to get under way; b) to come into being; to arise.
to approach; to go near.
a condemning as wrong; strong disapproval; a censuring or a censure; blame.
patience; tolerance - a) the state, quality or fact of being patient; b) a tolerating or being tolerant, esp. of views, beliefs, practices, etc. of others that differ from one's own.
a gradual decline; deterioration; degeneration; decay.
the amount of money expended; expense
ಉಪಕ್ಷಯಂ ಮಾಡು upakṣayam māḍu to spend money; to expend.
a throwing at; a hurling.
the commencement or the first portion of a literary work.
a large land mass, smaller than that usu. called a continent; often, a subdivision of a continent, regarded as a geographic or political entity; a sub-continent.
a sub-division of a clause of an act of a legislature; a sub-clause.
known widely; famous.
a sub-division of a group above a family but below a class of plants or animals; an order.
approached; drawn or came near (to).
happened; occurred; befallen.
associated with; joined or combined; engaged;4) accepted; agreed; consented.
the act of approaching; a going near.
attainment; acquiring.
the fact of being accepted; agreement; accord.
= ಉಪಗಮ.
(dial.) any thing that is used during the service of a deity or a respectable person.
a hillock or small mountain near a big mountain.
the region near a mountain.
a number that will divide another with no remainder; exact divisor (of a specified number); a sub-multiple; (as 3 is a sub-multiple of 12).
the act or an instance of keeping a thing from being seen; a hiding or concealing.
the act of holding (another person or each other) closely in the arms, usu. as a sign of affection; an embrace; a clasping.
the state of being astonished; amazement; astonishment; a surprise.
kept from being seen; hidden; concealed.
an inner apartment in a house; a room.
a relatively smaller house outside, esp. behind the main house, in the same premise.
held; grasped; seized.
the act of seizing or snatching (something from another).
a defeating or overpowering.
a taking or being taken by force, surprise or skill, as enemy troops; a capturing; a capture.
that which is taken by force or seizure; a captured person or thing; a prisoner.
favour; encouragement; assistance.
a satellite - a) a moon revolving around a larger planet; b) a man-made object rocketed into orbit around the earth, the moon, etc.
a treaty between two rival kings, in which the defeated one surrenders, for saving his life, major part of his wealth, kingdom etc.
seizure - a) the act of one who seizes or an instance of this; b) the state or an instance of being seized.
study of the Vedas after being formally initiated into them.
= ಉಪಗ್ರಹ - 7.
a small town near a bigger town to check overgrowth; a satellite town.
fit to be received; acceptable.
he who is morally, socially deserving the respect, gift, etc.
a gift offered to a king or a venerable person.
anything, in general, worthy of being given as a gift or donation.
a sudden action resulting in a powerful or destructive effect, from or as from a blow; a stroke; a blow; personal violence.
the impact of a blow or heavy stroke; injury.
a contiguous support.
a shelter; a support; protection.
the act or process of gathering together; collection; accumulation.
a mass of things collected and heaped up.
an improvement in one's condition; prosperity; progress.
medical attendance; treatment of a sick person.

= ಉಪಚರಣೆ.
a work done or duty performed for another or others; service.
hospitable treatment.

done; accomplished.
treated hospitably, medically etc.

the act of attending to a guest.
the act of attending a sick man; medical treatment; nursing.
a woman attendant; a maid.
a woman trained to take care of the sick, injured or aged, to assist surgeons, etc.; a female nurse.
a sacrificial fire that is produced as per the code of ritual.
a place, a platform or a hallow place where sacrificial fire is installed.
the act of going towards, near; approach.
service; attendance.
polite behaviour; politeness; civility; courteous treatment; hospitality.
treatment of the sick; medical attendance.
a pretending to be what one is not or to feel what one does not feel, esp. a pretence of virtue, piety, etc.; hypocrisy.
figurative or metaphorical expression.
anything, esp. money, given or promised to induce a person to do something illegal or wrong; a bribe.
a request; solicitation.
a person who attends or serves or nurses(another); an attendant.

to be treated.
to be attended with medical care.
to get or take money, etc. for showing some undue favour; to accept bribe.
a man who treats another hospitably.
a man who takes care of the sick.
= ಉಪಚರಿಸು.
the words that give comfort and make feel the other at home; courteous words; polite speech.
a merely complimentary saying; a flattering compliment.
he who deserves polite, courteous treatment.
medical attendance; treatment of sick a person.
collected; gathered together; accumulated.
heaped up; piled up.
increased; grown.
honoured; treated with respect; revered.
honourable; respectful.
the quality that deserves respect; a good quality, behaviour, conduct, etc.
the accumulated religious virtues.
excessive joy.
a particular kind of Kannaḍa metre.
a lunar mansions Corvus and Spica.
a special election held in the interval between regular elections, esp. one held to fill a vacancy in the parliament or legislative assembly; a by-election.
one of the paces of a horse.
a big lake or a part of a sea pushed in to the land, but distinguished from the main sea.
one of the paces of a horse.
occurring without conscious perception or with only slight perception, on the part of the individual (said of mental processes and reactions); sub-conscious.
subconscious mental activity; sub-conscious state.
the state of the mind in which the past impressions, experiences and reactions are present but not immediately available to consciousness; sub-consciousness.
produced; occurred; born; that has come into existence).
a sub-division of a social class, caste; a sub-caste.

(biol.) any natural subdivision of a species that exhibits small, but persistent, morphological variations from other subdivisions of the same species living in different geographical regions or times; a subspecies.
the act of one who whispers; whispering, esp. maligning a third person.
secret overtures of negotiations (with one's enemy's friends) sowing the seeds of dissension, treachery; the act and the scheme of splitting one's enemy from his friends or loyalists.
that which is told in whispers; a secret; a concealed scheme; rumour.
something said maliciously about a person not present; slander.
the act of one who whispers; whispering, esp. maligning a third person.

a thin leaf-shaped flap of cartilage, situated immediately behind the root of the tongue, which covers the entrance to the larynx during swallowing and prevents food from entering the windpipe. the epiglottis.
a disease of the epiglottis, marked by its swelling.
a kind of ant.
the slough of a snake not cast off.
a man who is dependent on another for his livelihood.
an author depending on others for material for his writing.
a leading of life depending on another for one's livelihood; the life of a parasite.
(gen.) one's means of livelihood.
a parasite a) a person who lives at the expense of another or others without making any useful contribution or return; hanger-on; b) (biol.) a plant or animal that lives so.
one's means of livelihood.
a living depending entirely on another person.
ಉಪಜೀವಿತನ್ upa jīvitan a person who lives at the expense of another or others without making any useful contribution or return; a hanger-on.
to live at the expense of another or others without earning for oneself.
a person who sponsors or supports living of another; a patron; a benefactor.
a source which or authority who supplies material to an author.
a very glad feeling; joy; happiness; pleasure; delight.
the state or fact of being silent; a refraining from speech or from making noise; silence.
he who has acquired knowledge by oneself and not handed down by tradition or taught by another; a self-enlightened man.
the ability of a person to acquire knowledge by ingenuity or creativity.
knowledge acquired by oneself and not handed down by tradition.
a woman who has acquired knowledge by herself without another's help.
= ಉಪಟಳ.
a distressing or difficult situation caused by another; trouble; irritation inflicted on another; annoyance.
one who inflicts trouble; a person that irritates, bothers or molests; an annoyer.
a respectful offering or presentation.
presented; gifted.
made ready, prepared or furnished with.
a respectful offering or presentation.
a small group of persons; a group within a group; a sub-group.
the disc of the sun (as it appears to us).
a circular array of troops.
much hotness; great warmth; heat.
pain, sorrow, agony or anguish inflicted; affliction.
any departure from health; illness; sickness; a disease.
to undergo or feel pain, sorrow, agony etc.; to be afflicted.
the condition or an instance of undergoing pain, sorrow, agony etc.; an afflicted condition.
a particular stance or trick in fighting in the battlefield.
the region at the foot of a mountain.

that which excites thirst or appetite; a small portion of a tasty food or drink that excites a desire for more food; an appetizer as a relish, condiment etc.
an infectious venereal disease caused by a spirochete (Treponema pallidum) and usually transmitted by sexual intercourse or acquired congenitally; syphilis.
a present, an offering made to a king or a respected person.
that which is given with no charge or cost; a free gift.
a sum of money or any reward offered, promissed to give or demanded in order to procure an (often illegal or dishonest) action or decision in favour of the giver; a bribe.
a bonus or bounty paid to service personnel on retirement, discharge etc.; gratuity.
smeared; anointed.
being taught; being enlightened.
directed; pointed at or towards.

a fault or defect (as in a poetical work etc.).
a present, an offering made to a king or a respected person.
something given to show friendship, affection, support, etc., a present; a gift.
a lesser god; a minor deity.
teaching of fundamentals of some subject to; instruction.
opinion given as to what to do or how to handle a situation; counsel; advice.
initiation or communication of a mystic hymn or a formula.

tending to advice; giving or containing advice.

a slough of a snake that is not cast of.

an annoying or being annoyed; annoyance; infliction.
any extreme misfortune bringing great loss and sorrow; disaster; calamity; deep trouble or misery.
sickness; any departure from good health; a disease.
causing, producing annoyance, disaster, evil or disease; harmful, malignant, destructive; malefic.
a man who causes or produces annoyance, disaster, evil etc.; a hamful, malignant man.
to enter in a forcibe or hostile manner; to invade; to attack.
to inflict trouble; to cause pain or suffering to; to distress; to afflict.
troubled; pained; distressed; afflicted.
(fem. ) he whose character, behaviour or conduct is detracted.
a land mass, not very large, surrounded by water, situated near a large island; a small island.

officiousness i.e. a) act of offering unnecessary and unwanted advice or services; b) an intrusion into, and meddling of, otheṛs affairs; impudently and impertinently concerning oneself with or taking part in others' affairs without being asked or needed; sauciness.
a person with the quality of officiousness or sauciness.
the tendency of offering unnecessary and unwanted advice or services, intruding into, meddling in others' affairs; impudent and impertinent concern with otheṛs business.
a leaning on; reclination; reposing.
a cloth case filled with feathers, down, foam rubber, air, etc., used as a support, as for leaning or reclining on; a side-pillow.
the act or state of lying on a side-pillow, while sitting, as for taking rest.
a running towards; a fast approaching.
he who is tried as per the code, of approved loyalty to a king.
she who is tried as per the code, of approved loyalty to a king.
to run towards; to approach fast.

the quality of being above suspicion in loyalty to a king.

the use of false representations to gain unjust advantage; deception.2) the quality of being deceitful; insincerity; cheating.
a pain, calamity or misery inflicted on.
brightness; radiance; brilliance; lustre.
the action or practice of deceiving; concealment or misrepresentation of the truth in order to mislead; deception; fraud; cheating.
a trial of one's sincerity, loyalty, honesty, etc.

the aspirate sound preceding the letters p and ph.
any of the variant forms of a phoneme as conditioned by position or adjoining sounds; allophone.

humbled; subjected; surrendered.
that which has happened, occurred or come into existence.
a small river or stream flowing into a larger one; a tributary; an influent.

(log.) the fourth member of the five membered Indian syllogism; the application to the special case in question.
the act or an instance of bringing near or carrying toward.

a religious function, held just before sending a Brāhmaṇa student to the residence of the teacher for learning, in which he is initiated with the hymn of light (the Gāyatri hymn) by his father and invested with the sacred thread; (now that religious function only).
a pair of eye-glasses; spectacles.
(rhet.) a particular kind of alliteration formed by sweeting sounding leters coming in succession.
(rhet.) the succession of the same words in a sentence; a figure of speech.
the family name or last name, as distinguished from a given name; surname.
an assistant or deputy of a leader.
a player in a team substituting the captain, in his absence; a vice-captain.
a hero in a dramatic or other literary work, whose importance is slightly less than that of the main hero; a second-hero.
a number of things tied, wrapped or otherwise held together; a bundle.
the peg of a Veeṇa (the Indian lute) to which the strings are attached and by which they are tightened or loosened.
a kind of medicinal ointment applied to a wound or sore.
something placed or entrusted for safekeeping; a deposit.
a rule or a regulation within a rule or regulation; a sub-regulation.
a supplementary law or an inferred regulation; a by-law.
a small town limited in size built near a great town to check overgrowth of the latter; a satellite town.
a vast philosophical writings, forming the concluding part of the Vedas and deals with the knowledge of the Supreme, considered as the essence of Indian philosophy.
one of the four Vedic vows undertaken by an individual.
a royal or main road.
brought near.
obtained; got; attained.
led to the teacher, after duly invested with the sacred thread.
a youth invested with the sacred thread and led to the teacher.
being led to or being brought towards.
a pair of lenses, in a frame, to help or correct faulty vision; spectacles.

lectured; described in detail.
the act or an instance of keeping, laying something very close.
opinion given as to what to do or how to handle a situation; counsel; an advice.

one of the sixteen kinds of treaty between two fighting kings.
ಉಪನ್ಯಾಸಕೊಡು upanyāsakoḍu to give a lecture; to deliver an informative talk on; 2. to advice; to counsel.
a man who gives lectures, esp. by profession or in connection with his teaching duties; a lecturer.
he who gives a talk on public platform on a subject, affair, etc.; a lecturer.

she who gives a talk on public platform on a subject, affair, etc.; a lecturer.
a series of lectures either by one person or different persons.

a man in relation to a woman not married but with whom he cohabits; a paramour.
a logical reason put forth or means used, for the establishment of a matter, in an argument.
something that tends to or helps prove the fact.
means of living or of supporting life; livelihood.
resources or available wealth.
a woman who cohabits with a man although not legally married to him; a concubine.
the fact or condition of being a concubine; the social practice of being so; concubinage.
a modified leaf, usually small and scale-like, sometimes large and brightly coloured, from whose axil grows a flower or inflorescence; a bract.
a sheathing bract, usu. a conspicuous one enclosing a spadix.

a word used as auxiliary to another; a secondary word of a sentence, as a preposition, particle, etc. prefixed to a verb or a noun derived from a verb which determines or qualifies the sense of the verb.
a word prefixed or previously uttered.
occurred; happened.
right; fit; proper; suitable.
accompanied or attended by.
a man who has more money or income-producing property; a wealthy man.

an unexpected occurrence.
a calamity; a disaster; misfortune; an accident.
destruction; demolition.
a sin that is not serious in nature or effect; a minor sin.

(Jain.) birth not happened in the normal course of generation; a not being born from the womb.
(biol.) the abdominal leg of an insect larva distinguished from a thoracic or 'true' leg; a proleg.
(Jain.) he who is self-produced; a god.
the act or process of demonstrating, proving, establishing.
the fact or matter so demonstrated or established.
to demonstrate; to prove; to establish; to explain.

a self-produced person; a god.
that which is to be proved by scientific experiment, logical argument etc.
any of the several sacred Hindu mythological works which are minor or secondary in nature.
an apparent accessory calyx outside of the true calyx, composed of bracts or of fused stipules of sepals; epicalyx.
a numbered sub-paragraph of a writing, a law, etc.; a sub-section.
a small piece of cloth used as a cover; a small sheet.
that part of the field of consciousness which at any given moment is outside the range of one's attention; the subconsciousness.
money given or promised to induce a person to do something; a bribe; a present.
a proposition that follows from another that has been proved; a corollary.
the benefit occurring as concomitant to the main purpose or benefit intended for.
a question auxiliary to another; a question forming a part of a larger question; a sub-question.
any happening that causes great harm or damage; serious or sudden misfortune; calamity; disaster.
an oppressing; a keeping down by the cruel or unjust use of power or authority; oppression; harassing.
a portent or natural phenomenon, as solar or lunar eclipse, a falling of a meteor, etc. believed to bring evil.
the feeling of alarm; fear; fright.

Śiva.
a condition of uncertainty; a doubt.
the act of providing, preparing, etc.; provision; preparation.

an increasing; growth.
a developing of a small object into a larger size; magnification.
a nourishing; nourishment.

devotion (to a god) as a condition accompanying (other aspect or fact of life).
that which is subdivided; an inner division of a larger division; a sub-division.

(ling.) a dialect - a) the form or variety of a spoken language peculiar to a region, community, social group, occupational group, etc. but is, to some degree, intelligible to the people speaking the main language; b) any language as a member of a group or family of languages.
eaten; chewed and swallowed.
(said of food, drink etc.) enjoyed; tasted.
enjoyed the rights, possession, and profits (of the property of another without damaging or altering the substance).
a small vessel, made of peepul wood (Ficus religiosa, Indian fig tree), used as a container for purified butter in sacrifices.
he who eats.
he who enjoyed the taste of food or drink.
a man who is using and enjoying or used or enjoyed, all the advantages and profits of the property of another without altering or damaging the substance.
a using or enjoying of a thing.
(law.) a using and enjoying of all the advantages and profits of the property of another without altering or damaging the substance.
= ಉಪಭೋಕ್ತೃ.
to eat or drink; to enjoy.
to have the use or benefit of.
(law.) to use, enjoy the benefits, advantages or profits of the property of another without damaging the substance.
that can be eaten, drunk or relished.
that can be possessed, used or enjoyed.
that can legally be used, taken advantages from (a substance) without altering or damaging (it).
a minister in a parliament or in a legislature, who works as a deputy or substitute in a limited sense, to a principal minister; a deputy minister.
the act or process of pressing hard or closely, exerting pressure on from all the sides or pressing in order to extract juice or any liquid from within, etc; a squeezing.
= ಉಪಮರ್ದ.
the section of the brain behind and below the cerebrum, that consists of two lateral lobes and a middle lobe, and functions as the coordinating centre for muscular movement; cerebellum.
(rhet.) one of the figures of speech in which an uncertainty is expressed in a subtle way.
(correctly, ಉಪಮೇಯಮಾಗು) to be likened; to be compared.
beyond comparison; so superior, that cannot be likened to any other; unique.
= ಉಪಮಾತೆ.
a woman having a familial relationship, as a mother, not by blood or adoption, but by virtue of nursing, bringing up or care; a foster mother.
(vīr.) a keeping of traditional teachers of yester years as standard or ideal for religious observations.
the state, fact or quality of resembling; similarity; resemblance.
the standard of comparison, with which anything is compared.
the likening of one thing to another on the basis of some similarity between the two, (which is considered as one of the four ways of substantiating an argument, in philosophy); analogy.
(rhet.) comparison of two objects, different from each other (considered one of the figures of speech); simile; comparison.
a conjunct word (as ಅಂತೆ, ಓಲ್, ಅಂತೆವೋಲ್ etc.) used in comparing two different things.
compared; likened.
a man who can be compared with; an ordinary man (as opp. to one incomparable).
= ಉಪಮಾವಾಚಕ.
to let oneself be likened to (another).
to represent or describe as being like or similar; to compare; to liken.
to give a detail account of in words; to describe.
to come forth as to be seen.
to dwindle; to become or grow less.
the state or quality of being similar; resemblance or likeness; similitude; similarity.
(rhet.) a figure of speech in which one thing is likened to another, dissimilar thing by the use of ಅಂತೆ, ಅಂತೆವೋಲ್, i.e. like, as, etc.; simile.
to understand or apprehend the similarity between two objects.
to be like another; to become comparable.
fit to be likened or compared; comparable with.
(rhet.) that which is compared to another; the subject of comparison.
(rhet.) a figure of speech in which the ಉಪಮೇಯ and ಉಪಮಾನ and are compared to each other with a view to imply that the like of them does not exist; a reciprocal comparison.
(rhet.) a figure of speech that is a combination of ಉಪಮೆ and ಉತ್ಪ್ರೇಕ್ಷೆ.
a marriage; wedding - a) the act of becoming married; marriage b) the marriage ceremony with its attendant festivities.
= ಉಪಯಮ.
used; utilised; employed for or applied to a given purpose.
that can be used to advantage; helpful; having practical utility; useful.

utilitarianism - a) the doctrine that the worth or value of anything is determined solely by its utility; b) the ethical theory which finds the basis of moral distinctions in the utility of actions, i.e. their fitness to produce happiness.
the quality or property of being useful; usefulness; utility.
the act of using or the state of being used; use; utilisation.
the quality or property of being useful; usefulness; utility.
benefit derived from using a thing.
a way of applying or method of applying or using; specific use; application.
a right kind of arrow for a particular situation.
a means perfectly suited to the situation.
to put or bring into action or service; employ for or apply to a given purpose; to make practical or profitable use of; to use; to utilise.
to be of use.
that can be used; fit, convenient or ready for use; usable.
an offering of food to an idol of a deity.
undergoing or undergone suffering, pain; afflicted; distressed.
made dark or obscure; eclipsed.
that has become red; reddened; turned to red.
the eclipsed sun or moon.
a small group of soldiers entrusted with the job of guarding the army camp.
drawn; depicted; outlined; sketched out.
a loose, long and unsewn cloth to cover the upper portion of the body or worn loosely above the upper garment.
left; abandoned; deserted; forlorn.
ceased to exist; dead.
withdrawn; retired from.
a man who has renounced desire for or is indifferent to, all worldly things.
a ceasing to exist; permanent ending of all life in a person, animal or plant; death; ಉಪರತವಶನಾಗು uparata vaśanāgu to stop living; to become dead; to pass from physical life; to die.
a ceasing or stopping.
a passing from one's physical life; death.
renunciation of all worldly desires.
an abstaining from activity.
(phil.) an abstention from prescribed acts with the conviction that ceremonial acts are futile and causing to rely on them.
an inferior gem.
(correctly, ಉಪಮಾರ್ಗ)a way, path, etc. between two points that avoids or is auxiliary to the main way; esp. an alternative highway route, as for skirting an urban area; a by-pass.
the plant Hernandia peltata of Hernandiacae family.
the quality, condition or an instance of being black or being obscured.
the partial or total obscuring of one celestial body by another, esp. of the sun when the moon comes between it and the earth or of the moon when the earth's shadow is cast upon it; an eclipse.
